text: St. Joseph's College, Sasse (Sasse College or Republic of Sasse) is a secondary school in the Southwest Region of Cameroon, with its campus located in Sasse, Buea. It was created in 1939 by the Mill Hill Missionaries. Affiliated with the Catholic faith as an all-male institution, it provides education at the first cycle and high school levels, offering programs in science and arts. In 2012, Sasse college was awarded the prize of the best school in West Africa. In 2013, Sasse College was awarded the pioneer prize of "Best School in Cameroon" by Fondation Terre d'accueil. ==See also== * Education in Cameroon Category:Educational institutions with year of establishment missing Category:Boys' schools in Africa Category:Buea Category:Catholic secondary schools in Africa Category:Secondary schools in Cameroon Category:Educational institutions established in 1939 Category:1939 establishments in British Cameroons
title: St. Joseph's College, Sasse
